    I bought the TV unit on 14th November 2021, got myself extended warranty right-away through amazon. About the TV itself, the picture quality is okay-ish, 1080p content looked good but playing 4K content on YouTube, made the app restart ALMOST ALL THE TIME. The panel has a tendency to over saturate colours, especially red and it is NOT PLEASING and no, it's not of much help trying to configure colour settings and often glitches. The unit takes a long time to boot up which is very inconvenient in the daily run. I had a hard time switching between apps and even though it has 2GB of memory, suppose you're playing music on Spotify and switch to YouTube to just browse through the UI, without playing anything on YouTube itself, the TV will kill Spotify in the background and the music stops. Skin tones look really bad and inaccurate, by bad I mean the skin tones produced by the panel get grayish or sometimes very peachy in colour, either way it's bad. The frame around the display panel is plastic, the bottom chin has a metal trim though. Now it was all bearable until 13th of July 2022, when the display started showing glitchy patches and bands making the TV unit useless for viewing anything at all, I contacted the support team right-away, they took up the issue and told the technician would visit in a week, no one showed up. After 10  days, I got back to them and they said pick up and drop service is not available in my area and now they wanted me to wait for another 24-48 hours for an update. Eventually a technician showed up on 27th of July, took the TV unit apart and took a couple of snaps of the insides of the TV and left saying they'll get back to me with updates. On 3rd of August, I contacted them again and they said the case was closed and that I should contact the technician myself and gave me a contact number. I dialled the same number, no one responded. Then I had to again contact them on 28th of August when they claimed to have completely processed my service request and that I had confirmed the same on 25th, when I hadn't received any calls or messages from them since August 3rd when I last contacted them myself. They said they had now escalated my case. On 6th September I received a call from OnePlus telling me that the replacement TV will reach me within 6 to 10 days maximum, guaranteed. I have the call recording for the same. Now it's October 10th, three months since I reported the issue to the company. I haven't received any support from them whatsoever. Now that I looked up reviews of the same TV, I could see countless of other customers facing the exact same issue and same response from the customer care. Looking forward to filing a case legally, against the firm. Please steer clear of OnePlus products, literally dead customer care team and after sales support. [UPDATE ON SERVICING]: I think the servicing day issue was due to COVID pandemic, and I have been told they will be available to service the purifier on both days of weekend as well. So that should put your mind at ease about servicing.Last and most important:v) Purifying mechanism - Its a little cumbersome and takes time to know how this thing works. so know this, it works best if water enters in full flow to purifier inlet. The LED 2nd from top which says "Purifying" flickers at a frequency depending on pressure. If there is very low pressure, the LED will beep at every 6-8 seconds and might even not been at all. If its medium pressure, it will beep at every 2-3 seconds. And if pressure is good/high, it will do continuous beep without flicker.Here are some issues or hints (depends) to help you know the working of this purifier.i) Problem 1 - There is no way to make it purify faster if flow pressure is low.ii) Problem 2 - Once pressure is too low the purifier will stop purifying, but once pressure comes back, many a times it won't resume purifying. so you have to switch it off and keep it off till power LED goes off and turn it on again.iii) Problem 3 - with low pressure once purifier stops working, most of the times it needs you to open the tap (and wait till water comes with full force and leave it like that for about 5 seconds and then close the tap) to help it with maintaining minimum necessary water pressure.All above problems occur if your Purifier inlet is set directly on water supply line which will have varying pressure through out the day depending when your home gets water. But if you have a storage before this purifier to feed water to it and that is at sufficient height or have a way to push water with sufficient pressure, you will not face any of the above listed problems.Once you know above three problems and way to workaround them wherever you can, it looks to be a decent purifier. and Generally with every purifier, it takes a little time (couple of weeks) to understand how it works or doesn't work.Hope this review helps. | Update 4th month of use!
